title: Attaching Documentation
intro: While controlling the exactness of data that users will capture, you can provide them with supplementary information on how one can carry out a task. This is done through Documentation. Each task present in a workflow can be augmented by adding documentation to it. A documentation takes form of a file, a picture a voice or text memo or a URL. Users running your template are then free to consult the documentation provided to help them in their tasks.

blocks.content: In the Template Editor, expand a task where documentation should be added, and hit the “Add documentation” link.
A new window opens, select the type of documentation you wish to add on the left, and supply the relevant information on the right side of the screen. Save when done.
The documentation section visually informs you a documentation has been added to the task.
To re-open of edit the Documentation added to a step, click on any visual icon for a documentation and the Documentation editor window will pop-up again.

blocks.caption: A thumbnail shows a documentation attached to a step

When tapping on the documentation, the user is taken to the 'Doco-Mode' navigation where a large version of all documentation attached to step can be seen. Here, one can also action of the relevant step.
